Bacardi, Francesca. http://radaronline.com/exclusives/2014/06/clint-eastwood-new-girlfriend-short-marriage-hell "Clint Eastwood's New Girlfriend Married For Only ONE YEAR Before Divorcing — Inside The ‘Hellish’ Union", Radar Online, June 30, 2014; retrieved November 7, 2015
children: May 1989 articles from the ''Los Angeles Times'' http://articles.latimes.com/1989-05-08/entertainment/ca-2546_1_eastwood-and-locke-palimony-suit-mr-eastwood/2 and ''People'' magazine http://people.com/archive/suing-clint-eastwood-sondra-locke-strikes-with-magnum-force-vol-31-no-19/, both error-ridden (e.g., Locke's age) list Eastwood as having only two children.
A March 1999 ''People'' article http://people.com/archive/learning-experience-vol-51-no-9/ mentions in passing that Eastwood has five children.

Only four children are acknowledged in Eastwood's October 2003 episode of ''Biography''. Lack of mention of Eastwood's daughter by Roxanne Tunis and his two children by Jacelyn Reeves was noted in a review by ''The Dallas Morning News''.
The October 2012 issue of ''Esquire'' http://www.esquire.com/entertainment/movies/interviews/a15877/clint-eastwood-profile-1012/ says Eastwood is father to seven children by five different women.

In a French documentary, ''L'album secret de Clint Eastwood'' (2012), biographer Patrick McGilligan says on camera, "We don't know how many children Clint has had with how many women" and proceeds to name seven of Eastwood's offspring before adding, "I heard of other possibilities."
An October 2013 CNN news report http://www.cnn.com/2013/10/24/showbiz/clint-eastwood-divorce/ states "He's had eight children total by six women."
